A1: people have been killed in Syria
RelatedSentence: More than 162,000 people have been killed in Syria since the conflict broke out in March 2011 , the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights says .
The Britain-based monitoring group , which relies on a network of sources on the ground , said on Monday it had documented the deaths of 162,402 people .

The group said 42,701 members of the armed opposition had been killed , including more than 13,500 fighters from jihadist groups like al - Qaeda affiliate al - Nusra Front and the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant or ISIL .

A0: the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights
RelatedSentence: The Observatory also documented the deaths of 438 members of Lebanon 's Hezbollah movement , which is fighting alongside the regime , and 1224 other non-Syrian pro-regime fighters .

A0: the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights
RelatedSentence: The toll also includes 2891 unidentified people whose deaths the Observatory has confirmed without being able to record their identities .
